sub_title: Part-time Prof in the Dpt of Precision Medicine, Maastricht University, specialized  in tumour hypoxia, Radiomics, I.O., genetically engineered Clostridium & serial entrepreneur
summary:
Philippe Lambin is a Clinician-Scientist, Oncologist by training, “ERC advanced, EIC accelerator & ERC PoC (3x) grant laureate” and pioneer in translational research with a focus on Radiomics, AI-based Decision Support Systems, tumour hypoxia and living medicine. He has a PhD in Molecular Biology, is Professor at Maastricht University. He is co-author of more than 616 peer reviewed scientific papers (>63K citations, Hirsch Index:  119 Google scholar, https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7961-0191), co-inventor of multiple patents, some of them commercialised, and (co) promoter of more than 70 completed PhD’s.
His main areas of interest are directed towards translational research in Cancer Biology with a specific focus on tumour hypoxia, quantitative imaging (Radiomics) and genetically engineered Clostridium as living medicine or factory able to produce biotherapeutics, vaccines and green energy. More recently, his interests have been directed towards Hypoxia Activated Prodrugs, during immunotherapy. He is one of the inventors of “Radiomics” (quantitative imaging), Clinical Decision Support, “Medomics”, “Federated learning” a revolutionary Big Data approach for health care. Few years ago, his research group received the highest possible score by an international external review committee and was described as having a “world-leading position”. The reviewers added, “In large part, this is due to the inspirational leadership of Prof. P. Lambin". In 2017, he launched a new discipline-agnostic Dpt of Precision Medicine (www.precisionmedicinemaastricht.eu) focusing on convergence sciences, within and beyond oncology, and dedicate his time to research, in particular his ERC advanced grants & supervision of his PhD students. He is also a serial entrepreneur, scientific advisor & co-founder of Radiomics.bio, Comunicare Solutions, Convert Pharmaceuticals, LivingMed Biotech and Bactam.bio.

authors.headline: Part-time Prof in the Dpt of Precision Medicine, Maastricht University, specialized  in tumour hypoxia, Radiomics, I.O., genetically engineered Clostridium & serial entrepreneur

profile_positions.description: In the Dpt of Precision Medicine we believe in Convergence Sciences: the intersection of medical Sciences, Biology and Technology. We have three units: The D-Lab is working on multifactorial Decision Support Systems (visit www.Precisionmedicinemaastricht.eu) and The M-Lab group is developing biomarkers and new therapies targeting the tumour microenvironment. The trial unit (VTU) is managing real world and In Silico prospective clinical trials (phase 1, phase 2a, randomised phase 2, cohort studies and In Silico trials).
